structured.description: A Camera class with various methods for calculating and manipulating matrices related to camera projection and viewport adjustments. The class uses packages such as Matrix4f and Vector3f for mathematical operations. The main methods include calculateViewMatrix, getTranslationMatrix, and adjustToViewport, which are used to transform camera positions and views based on user input or calculations. Additionally, the code includes a abstract class called CameraStruct with its own methods for calculating matrices, indicating that it is an abstract base class for other classes that inherit from it.

    Matrix4f -> Camera [dir="both", penwidth=6]
}

items.description: Is an abstract class that provides methods for calculating view and projection matrices, as well as adjusting to a specified viewport size. It also has a `getTransform()` method for retrieving the transform of the camera. Additionally, it has an abstract method `calculateProjectionMatrix(CameraStruct data)` and an abstract class `CameraStruct` for storing camera-related data.
items.name: Camera

items.description: Retrieves and returns a `Matrix4f` object representing the view projection transformation, which is calculated either from a pre-defined matrix or updated based on changes to the transform property.

returns.description: a Matrix4f object representing the view projection matrix.

items.name: getViewProjection

items.description: Calculates the view matrix for a given camera transformation and translation, by multiplying the rotation matrix and translation matrix using the `projection` matrix.

returns.description: a 4x4 matrix representing the view transformation of a 3D camera.

usage.description: In this example, we create a new instance of the Camera class with a projection matrix and then set the position and rotation of the transform using the getTransform method. We then call calculateViewMatrix() on the camera object, which returns a Matrix4f that represents the view projection matrix for the camera.

items.name: calculateViewMatrix

items.description: Generates a matrix that represents the translation of a given position from the world space to the camera space.

returns.description: a 4x4 matrix representing the translation of the camera position.

items.name: getTranslationMatrix

items.description: Returns the `transform` object, which contains the transformation logic for the application.
items.name: getTransform

items.description: Is an abstract class with an abstract method `getAsMatrix4()` and no fields. This class serves as a base for other classes that extend the `Camera` class, allowing them to define their own structure and methods specific to each class.
items.name: CameraStruct
